column5: Hey everyone i just went out to crappy tire for some swivel hooks and i picked up tome Bubble Gum colored Tiki Stick 5'' Wave worms.Has anyone used these i think i have seen them in some pictures on the board dangling out of bass's mouth's. If im correct, can someone tell me the best way to rig them?Any help would be appreciated. Thanks -Little Angler

wacky has it's time and place but by far the standard through the top a quarter of an inch and out down the tiki stick is probably the best all round, basically texas rigged without a weight  never used the bubble gum  but try and get some of the colour (sweet potato pie) the bass just destroy them big and small, and if you want a real slow fall try the wave worm bamboo stick which is basically a thicker tiki stick

I've had lots of success with the bubble gum tiki worm, in both 4 and 5".  Have fun with 'em but its always a good idea to have another colour and/or sizes handy in case the fish don't like what you've got.
Have worked well this year so far...in that make and colour...
I like the Tiki Sticks, great affordable alternative to senkos. I've done well with the bubblegum colour.
Bubble gum works great in lakes like rice and scugog, just dont waste your money on Bass-Magnet and you should do just fine
